intro: Galactites tomentosus var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often large and broad. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. This species thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna environments.
